lexUnit.name: bottom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the lowest point, position, or part of something.

sentence.text: Line the bottom of the basin with the small bread circle then arrange the bread slices around the sides .
And now , on a clear morning , Graham Little and I are sitting at the bottom of the wall , fit and ready to go , and the wall is plastered with verglas .

She took the basket back into the dressing-room and threw a cloth over it , then began to undress , bundling her discarded clothes into the bottom of one of the huge built-in cupboards that lined the walls .
Me , I had reached the bottom of the bottle and figured I had lost enough for one weekend .
Ant : Get your tracksuit bottoms then .
Wilcox set off in a straight line , indifferent to the snow that covered his thin black shoes and clung to his trouser bottoms .
The water in the bottom of the boat grew deeper .
When I did emerge to eat , he remarked gloomily that he 'd managed to stick them to the bottom of the pan .
Wycliffe sat on the bottom of the bed .
We know that they could live in extremely shallow to very deep-water environments , that most lived on or near the sea bottom , but a few were adapted to open-ocean swimming .
At the bottom of the hill , they just stop and it 's a normal street .
Near the bottom of Birdlip hill , things stared to go wrong .
The photo at the bottom of the page shows a player teeing off in a left-to-right crosswind .
To create this light style , the company address and other essential information can be relegated to the bottom of the page .
At Marienburg the Orcs fought a massive and bloody sea battle against the Empire fleet , sending half the Imperial ships to the bottom of the sea and scattering the rest to the four winds .
How many ships had gone to the bottom of the sea ?
She heard it crash to the bottom of the stairs , and felt the floor quiver as it gained on her .
As he was speaking , he was pushing her relentlessly towards the bottom of the stairs .
